4. MINORS AS TRAVELLERS: 
A. PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF 18 YEARS ARE
CONSIDERED MINORS. 
B. SHALL FOLLOW THE PROTOCOL APPLIED
TO THEIR PARENT OR GUARDIAN. 
C. WHEN TRAVELLING ALONE WILL QUARANTINE WITH
A GUARDIAN IN A PRIVATE RESIDENCE FOR THE PERIOD
AS DETERMINED BY THEIR COUNTRY OF ORIGIN AND THEIR
VACCINATION STATUS. 
PROCESS ON ARRIVAL: 
ARRIVAL ASSESSMENT: 
A. REVIEW OF ONLINE PRE-ARRIVAL FORM. 
ESTABLISH SARS-COV-2/COVID-19 STATUS: 
A. APPROVAL OF SARS-COV-2 TEST RESULT BY PORT
HEALTH TEAM. 
B. COLLECTION OF A NASAL SWAB SPECIMEN FOR A
COVID-19 PCR TEST FROM ALL QUALIFYING DISEMBARKING
TRAVELLERS. 
C. ALL TRAVELLERS WILL BE ASSESSED BY THE PORT HEALTH
OFFICERS TO DETERMINE THEIR FINAL LEVEL OF RISK AND
THE LENGTH OF MANDATORY QUARANTINE REQUIRED. 
D. ALL TRAVELLERS WILL BE REQUIRED TO MONITOR THEIR
TEMPERATURES AND OTHER SYMPTOMS FOR THE NEXT
10 DAYS AND REPORT ANY
ABNORMALITIES TO THE LOCAL
HEALTH AUTHORITY. 
E. ALL TRAVELLERS WITH A POSITIVE COVID-19 PCR TEST
RESULT WILL BE ISOLATED IN AN APPROVED 
ACCOMMODATION/FACILITY AT THE TRAVELLER'S
OWN COST. 
REQUIREMENTS OF DISCHARGE FROM QUARANTINE: 
1. OBJECTIVE MEASURES: 
A. NEGATIVE PCR TEST 
B. NOT A CLOSE CONTACT OF A POSITIVE COVID-19 CASE. 
2. SUBJECTIVE MEASURES: 
A. ABSENCE OF SIGNS AND SYMPTOMS OF COVID-19. 
3. NOT DETERMINED TO BE AT HIGH RISK FOR BEING EXPOSED TO
 COVID-19.

PLEASE AMEND THE NOTES ON PAGE ENR 3.2 UL462 (RNAV10)-1 TO
READ:
'3. RNAV 10 REPRESENTS A NAVIGATION ACCURACY OF 10NM ON A 95
PERCENT
CONTAINMENT BASIS AS DETAILED IN PBN MANUAL ICAO DOC 9613.'
AND REMOVE:
'5. AIRCRAFT MUST BE RNAV 10 EQUIPPED USING GNSS SENSOR TO FLY THIS
ROUTE.'

Text:
ST. KITTS AND NEVIS HAS ISSUED A TRAVEL ADVISORY FOR TRAVELLERS
FROM BRAZIL. 
PERSONS FROM THE AFOREMENTIONED COUNTRY ARE ADVISED NOT TO TRAVEL 
TO ST. KITTS AND NEVIS AT THIS TIME. ENTRY INTO THE FEDERATION WILL
BE DENIED. CITIZENS AND RESIDENTS OF ST. KITTS AND NEVIS WHO ARE 
ARRIVING FROM BRAZIL MUST PROCESS THEIR TRAVEL 
REQUESTS THROUGH THE ONLINE PLATFORM WWW.KNATRAVELFORM.KN AND WILL
BE 
REQUIRED TO QUARANTINE FOR 14 DAYS UPON ARRIVAL, EVEN IF THEY HAVE
BEEN FULLY VACCINATED FOR TWO WEEKS OR MORE PRIOR TO THEIR ARRIVAL.
THE GOVERNMENT HAS ISSUED THE ADVISORY IN RESPONSE TO COVID-19 
VARIANTS THAT HAVE ORIGINATED IN BRAZIL.

COMMENCED FROM SUNDAY, OCTOBER 31ST, 2021:
1. WHERE FULLY VACCINATED TRAVELLERS  ARE THOSE PERSONS WHO:
A. HAVE COMPLETED A VACCINATION REGIMEN WITH ONE OF THE FOLLOWING
COVID-19
VACCINES RECOGNIZED BY THE MINISTRY OF HEALTH, WELLNESS AND THE
ENVIRONMENT
OF ST. VINCENT AND THE GRENADINES:
I. ASTRAZENECA - OXFORD ASTRAZENECA (VAXZEVRIA), COVISHIELD,
ASTRAZENECA COVID-19 VACCINE BY SK BIOSCIENCE
II. PVIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE
III. MODERNA COVID-19 VACCINE
IV. JANSSEN (JOHNSON JOHNSON)
V. GAMALAYA (SPUTNIK V, GAM-COVID-VAC)
VI. CUBAN COVID-19 VACCINE - ABDALA, SOBERANA.
VII. SINOVAC, SINOPHARM
B. AT LEAST TWO (2) WEEKS HAVE PASSED SINCE THE LAST DOSE OF A TWO
(2) DOSE
VACCINE OR THE SINGLE DOSE OF A ONE (1) DOSE VACCINE
C. PRESENT WITH A VACCINE CERTIFICATE IN ENGLISH WHICH WILL BE
VALIDATED EITHER
PRE-ARRIVAL OR AT THE POINT OF ENTRY BY ONE OF THE FOLLOWING:
I. PROOF OF ISSUANCE FROM A NATIONAL PUBLIC HEALTH ORGANIZATION
II. PROOF OF DOCUMENTED VACCINATION ISSUED BY A HOSPITAL OR
MEDICAL
CENTRE.  
2. FULLY VACCINATED TRAVELLERS TO ST. VINCENT AND THE GRENADINES
MUST ARRIVE
WITH A NEGATIVE SARS-COV-2 RT-PCR COVID-19 TEST RESULT AS PER THE
FOLLOWING:
A. VERY HIGH-RISK COUNTRIES, HIGH-RISK AND MEDIUM-RISK COUNTRIES:
I. ST. KITTS AND NEVIS, GRENADA, TAIWAN, BERMUDA, DOMINICA,
BARBADOS, ANTIGUA AND BARBUDA  
BRAZIL, VENEZUELA, TRINIDAD AND TOBAGO, ECUADOR, SOUTH AFRICA,
SURINAME, COLOMBIA, BELIZE, MEXICO, INDIA, GUYANA, PANAMA,
ARGENTINA, PERU, BRITISH VIRGIN
ISLAND, UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, INCLUDING THE
UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS (USVI), CHINA, UNITED KINGDOM,
GERMANY, ST. LUCIA, JAMAICA,

ISLAND ? RESORT, MUSTIQUE. 
III. TRAVELLERS FROM BRAZIL AND SOUTH AFRICA
MUST COMPLY WITH THE GENERAL PROTOCOL AND
NOT THE RESORT SPECIFIC BUBBLE RESORT PROTOCOL. 
F. ANY OTHER COUNTRY NOT ASSIGNED TO THE ABOVE
CATEGORIES SHOULD BE ASSUMED TO BE HIGH RISK. 
G. HIGH RISK OCCUPATIONS INCLUDE:  
I. HEALTH CARE WORKERS (CURRENT) 
II. PRISON/DETENTION FACILITY WORKERS.
H. FULLY VACCINATED TRAVELLERS - SEE PROTOCOL FOR
FULLY VACCINATED TRAVELLERS. 
2. IN-TRANSIT PASSENGERS: 
A. THROUGH ST. VINCENT AND THE GRENADINES: 
I. MUST HAVE A NEGATIVE COVID-19 PCR TEST
RESULT DONE WITHIN 72 HOURS OF ARRIVAL. 
II. IF THE IN-TRANSIT PERIOD DOES NOT INCLUDE
AN OVERNIGHT STAY, THAT PERIOD MUST BE SPENT
AT THE ARGYLE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT. 
III. IF THE IN-TRANSIT PERIOD INCLUDES AN OVERNIGHT
STAY, THAT PERIOD MUST BE SPENT IN A TA/MOHWE
APPROVED HOTEL. 
B. TRAVELLERS INTENDING TO TRANSIT THROUGH
ANOTHER COUNTRY FROM ST. VINCENT AND THE
GRENADINES ARE ADVISED TO VISIT THE COUNTRY
TRAVEL WEBSITE TO DETERMINE THE REQUIREMENTS
FOR TRAVEL. FOR: 
I. GRENADA - 
HTTPS://WWW.NOWGRENADA.COM/2020/07/PROTOCOL
-FOR-TRAVELLERS- INTO-GRENADA/
II. ANTIGUA - 
HTTPS://VISITANTIGUABARBUDA.COM/TRAVEL-ADVISORY/ 
III.
BARBADOS - 
HTTPS://WWW.VISITBARBADOS.ORG/COVID-19-
TRAVEL-GUIDELINES-2020 
IV. ST. LUCIA - 
HTTPS://WWW.STLUCIA.ORG/EN/COVID-19/ 
3. DIPLOMATS: 
A. MUST HAVE A NEGATIVE PCR COVID-19 TEST
RESULT DONE WITHIN 72 HOURS OF ARRIVAL. 
B. ALL DIPLOMATS MUST QUARANTINE FOR THE
DURATION OF TIME AS PER THE APPROVED
PROTOCOLS. THE SITE OF QUARANTINE WILL BE
AT THE DISCRETION OF THE CHIEF MEDICAL OFFICER
OR THE MEDICAL OFFICER OF HEALTH.

PROTOCOL FOR THE ENTRY OF UNVACCINATED TRAVELLERS TO ST.
VINCENT AND THE GRENADINES. COMMENCING WEDNESDAY OCTOBER 13, 2021 
1. TRAVELLERS TO ST. VINCENT AND THE GRENADINES
MUST ARRIVE WITH A NEGATIVE SARS-COV-2 RT-PCR
COVID-19 TEST RESULT AS PER THE FOLLOWING: 
A. VERY HIGH-RISK COUNTRIES: 
I. VENEZUELA, BRAZIL, ECUADOR,
SOUTH AFRICA, SURINAME, COLOMBIA, BELIZE, MEXICO,
INDIA, GUYANA, PANAMA, ARGENTINA, PERU. 
II. MUST ARRIVE WITH A NEGATIVE RESULT OF A 
COVID-19 (RT-PCR) TEST DONE NO MORE THAN SEVENTY-TWO 
(72) HOURS OR THREE (3) DAYS BEFORE ARRIVAL. 
III. MAY BE RETESTED FOR COVID-19 (RT-PCR) ON
ARRIVAL IN SVG. 
IV. MANDATORY QUARANTINE FOR FOURTEEN (14) DAYS IN A TOURISM 
AUTHORITY/MOHWE APPROVED TRANSITION/QUARANTINE
HOTEL AT THEIR COST. MUST ARRIVE WITH PROOF OF THE
FULLY PAID RESERVATION. 
V. MUST TRANSFER TO THE TRANSITION HOTEL IN AN
APPROVED AIA TAXI OR APPROVED VESSEL
(PLANE OR FERRY) AT OWN EXPENSE.
 VI. MUST BE RETESTED ON DAY SEVEN (7) AND DAY 
FOURTEEN (14) OF QUARANTINE. 
B. HIGH RISK COUNTRIES: 
I. BRITISH VIRGIN ISLANDS, TRINIDAD AND TOBAGO, DOMINICA,
BARBADOS,
BERMUDA, ANTIGUA AND BARBUDA, UNITED STATES OF AMERICA,
INCLUDING THE UNITED STATES, VIRGIN ISLANDS (USVI), 
CHINA, UNITED KINGDOM, GRENADA, GERMANY,
ST. LUCIA, JAMAICA, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC, HAITI, CUBA,
NIGERIA, INDONESIA, PHILIPPINES, ITALY, BAHAMAS, CANADA,
TURKS AND CAICOS ISLANDS, FRANCE (INCLUDING OVERSEAS
REGIONS), SPAIN AND RUSSIA.
II. MUST ARRIVE WITH A NEGATIVE RESULT OF A COVID-19
(RT-PCR) TEST DONE NO MORE THAN
SEVENTY-TWO
(72) HOURS OR THREE (3) DAYS BEFORE ARRIVAL. 
III. MAY BE RETESTED FOR COVID-19 (RT-PCR) ON ARRIVAL

IN SVG. 
IV. MANDATORY QUARANTINE FOR TEN (10) DAYS
IN A TOURISM AUTHORITY/MOHWE APPROVED
TRANSITION/QUARANTINE HOTEL AT THEIR COST. MUST
ARRIVE WITH PROOF OF THE FULLY PAID RESERVATION. 
V. MUST TRANSFER TO THE TRANSITION HOTEL IN AN
APPROVED AIA TAXI OR APPROVED VESSEL
(PLANE OR FERRY) AT OWN EXPENSE. 
VI. MUST BE RETESTED BETWEEN DAY SEVEN (7) AND DAY TEN
(10) OF QUARANTINE. 
C. MEDIUM RISK COUNTRIES (THE COUNTRY OF
RESIDENCE WILL BE THE LAST COUNTRY THAT THE
TRAVELLER WAS PRESENT IN FOR AT LEAST 21 DAYS):
I. ST. KITTS NEVIS, TAIWAN
II. MUST ARRIVE WITH A NEGATIVE RESULT OF A
COVID-19 (RT-PCR) TEST DONE NO MORE THAN 72
HOURS BEFORE ARRIVAL. 
III. MAY BE RETESTED ON ARRIVAL IN SVG. 
IV. MANDATORY QUARANTINE FOR FIVE (5) DAYS
IN A TOURISM AUTHORITY/MOHWE APPROVED
TRANSITION/QUARANTINE HOTEL AT THEIR COST. 
V. MUST BE RETESTED ON DAY FOUR (4) OF QUARANTINE.
D. LOW RISK COUNTRIES (THE COUNTRY OF RESIDENCE WILL BE
THE LAST COUNTRY THAT THE TRAVELLER WAS PRESENT IN
FOR AT LEAST 21 DAYS): 
I. ANGUILLA, MONTSERRAT: 
II. MUST ARRIVE WITH A NEGATIVE RESULT OF A COVID-19
(RT-PCR) TEST DONE NO MORE THAN 72 HOURS BEFORE ARRIVAL.
III. MAY BE TESTED ON ARRIVAL IN SVG AT THE
DISCRETION OF THE PORT HEALTH OFFICER.
IV. MUST QUARANTINE FOR THREE (3) DAYS 
E. RESORT
SPECIFIC BUBBLE PROTOCOL HOTELS IN SVG:
I. RESORT SPECIFIC PROTOCOLS MUST BE
APPROVED
BY THE HEALTH SERVICES SUBCOMMITTEE OF THE
NATIONAL EMERGENCY ORGANIZATION AND BEAR
THE STAMP OF THE NEMO. 
II. RESORT SPECIFIC BUBBLE PROTOCOL APPROVED
HOTELS: MANDARIN ORIENTAL CANOUAN, SOHO
BEACH HOUSE CANOUAN, CANOUAN ESTATES RESORT
AND VILLAS, BEQUIA BEACH HOTEL, PETIT ST. VINCENT

WIP CWY RWY 10. HEAVY EQPT OPR ON LOOKOUT HILL. PILOTS ARE ASKED
TO EXER CTN ON DEP.

WITH IMMEDIATE EFFECT, ALL NON SCHEDULED ACFT SEEKING TO
TRANSPORT PASSENGERS INTO DOMINICA ARE REQUIRED TO OBTAIN PRIOR
APPROVAL FROM THE MINISTER OF NATIONAL SECURITY. SEND REQUEST TO
CEO(AT)DASPA.DM.
PILOTS WHO DO NOT MEET THE NECESSARY REQUIREMENTS WILL NOT BE
PERMITTED TO LAND, AS PRESCRIBED BY THE APPROPRIATE AUTHORITY.

(1) SUBMIT A HEALTH QUESTIONNAIRE ONLINE AT LEAST 24 HOURS PRIOR
TO ARRIVAL IN TDPD AT HTTP://DOMCOVID19.DOMINICA.GOV.DM. 
(2) SHOW THE NOTIFICATION OF CLEARANCE TO TRAVEL. 
(3) SUBMIT A NEGATIVE PCR TEST RESULT RECORDED WITHIN 24-72 HOURS 
PRIOR TO ARRIVAL.
GENERAL PROTOCOLS AND GUIDELINES UPON ARRIVAL:
(1) TRAVELLERS ARE REQUIRED TO WEAR FACE MASKS AT ALL TIMES DURING
ARRIVAL PROCESS UP TO AND INCLUDING DEPARTURE FROM THE AIRPORT. 
(2) MUST OBSERVE PHYSICAL DISTANCING GUIDELINES. 
(3) MUST PRACTICE GOOD RESPIRATORY AND PERSONAL SANITATION. 
(4) MUST FOLLOW ALL INSTRUCTIONS OF HEALTH CARE STAFF AND OFFICIALS.
VACCINATED PASSENGERS: DISEMBARKATION TRAVELLERS WILL: 
(1) BE REQUIRED TO SANITIZE THEIR HANDS AT SANITATION STATIONS AS
DIRECTED.
(2) BE REQUIRED TO UNDERGO A HEALTH ASSESSMENT TO INCLUDE A 
TEMPERATURE CHECK. 
(3) PROVIDE CONFIRMATION OF THE HEALTH CLEARANCE TO TRAVEL, NEGATIVE
PCR TEST RESULTS, VACCINATION CERTIFICATE AND IF APPLICABLE,
MEDICAL RECORD AS PROOF OF PREVIOUS INFECTION OF COVID-19. 
VACCINATED PASSENGERS: QUARANTINE AND TESTING.
(1) FULLY VACCINATED PASSENGERS SHALL BE TRANSPORTED TO A
GOVERNMENT-OPERATED QUARANTINE FACILITY OR A MANAGED EXPERIENCE AT A 
SAFE IN NATURE-CERTIFIED PROPERTY FOR A MINIMUM OF 2 DAYS. 
(2)A PCR TEST WILL BE ADMINISTERED TO THE FULLY VACCINATED TRAVELLER 
ON DAY 2 AFTER ARRIVAL AND THE TRAVELLER WILL AWAIT THE RESULTS FOR
UP TO 24 HOURS.
UNVACCINATED PASSENGERS: DISEMBARKATION
(1) BE REQUIRED TO SANITIZE THEIR HANDS AT SANITATION STATIONS AS
DIRECTED.
(2) BE REQUIRED TO UNDERGO A HEALTH ASSESSMENT TO INCLUDE A 
TEMPERATURE CHECK.
(3) PROVIDE CONFIRMATION OF THE HEALTH CLEARANCE TO TRAVEL,

NO MARKINGS ON HELICOPTER STANDS P0, R2, P142, P152, P96 AND
P97
REF CAR-SAM-NAM AIRAC AIP SUP 001/21
(INTERNET : WWW.SIA.AVIATION-CIVILE.GOUV.FR)

AS PER SECTION 10 OF STATUTORY INSTRUMENT OF THE GOVERNMENT OF 
SAINT LUCIA, NUMBER 114 OF 2020: TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS.
THE HEWANORRA INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT IS OPEN TO REGIONAL AND 
INTERNATIONAL FLIGHTS. 
FOR THE PURPOSES OF PREVENTING, CONTROLLING AND SUPPRESSING 
THE SPREAD OF COVID-19:
1) ALL DEPARTING PASSENGERS WILL BE SUBJECT TO TEMPERATURE 
SCREENING.
2) ALL ARRIVING PASSENGERS WILL BE FIRST PROCESSED BY PORT 
HEALTH UPON ARRIVAL INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, TEMPERATURE 
SCREENING.
3) EFFECTIVE 01 JULY 2021, SAINT LUCIA WILL NO LONGER UPHOLD A
CARIBBEAN BUBBLE.
4) ALL ARRIVING PASSENGERS ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE DOCUMENTED
PROOF OF A NEGATIVE POLYMERASE CHAIN REACTION (PCR) TEST RESULT
FOR COVID-19 OBTAINED WITHIN 5 DAYS/120 HOURS PRIOR TO DATE
OF PLANNED ARRIVAL IN SAINT LUCIA. PROOF OF THE NEGATIVE PCR 
TEST RESULT FOR COVID-19, MUST BE PRESENTED PRIOR TO DEPARTURE
AND UPON ARRIVAL IN SAINT LUCIA.
5) NOTWITHSTANDING AN ARRIVING PASSENGER PRESENTING PROOF OF THE 
REQUIRED NEGATIVE RESULT OF A PCR TEST FOR COVID-19 OBTAINED WITHIN
5 DAYS/120 HOURS OF TRAVEL TO SAINT LUCIA, A DETERMINATION CAN BE 
MADE UPON ARRIVAL AND BASED ON ASSESSMENT BY THE RELEVANT HEALTH
AUTHORITIES THAT ANOTHER PCR TEST OF THE PASSENGER IS REQUIRED.
THE ARRIVING PASSENGER WILL BE SO TESTED AND WILL BE REQUIRED TO
PAY FOR THE PCR TEST IN THE AMOUNT OF 270.00 XCD, IN ACCORDANCE 
WITH THE PROVISION OF STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NUMBER 118 OF 2020.
6) IN-TRANSIT PASSENGERS TRANSFERRING ON THE SAME DAY WILL BE
SUBJECT TO TEMPERATURE SCREENING ON ARRIVAL. IT IS STRONGLY 
ADVISED THAT IN-TRANSIT PASSENGERS OBTAIN A NEGATIVE PCR TEST

WITHIN 5 DAYS/120 HOURS OF TRAVEL.
7) ALL ARRIVING ADULT PASSENGERS (AGE 18 YEARS AND OLDER) MUST 
COMPLETE THE RELEVANT PRE-ARRIVAL REGISTRATION FORM AT
WWW.STLUCIA.ORG/COVID-19. MINORS (AGE 17 YEARS AND YOUNGER)
MUST BE INCLUDED ON THE REGISTRATION FORM OF THEIR ACCOMPANYING
PARENT OR GUARDIAN. UNACCOMPANIED MINORS MUST HAVE A PRE-ARRIVAL
FORM SUBMITTED ON THEIR BEHALF.
8) ALL DETAILS ON THE PRE-ARRIVAL REGISTRATION FORM MUST BE 
COMPLETED, INCLUDING PROOF OF NEGATIVE PCR TEST.
9) QUARANTINE SHALL BE DEEMED TO BE A PERIOD OF NO LESS THAN 
14 DAYS.
10) ALL ARRIVING PASSENGERS WHO ARE NOT FULLY VACCINATED FOR
COVID-19, IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NUMBER 86C
OF 2021 (COVID-19 TESTING AND QUARANTINE REGULATIONS), SHALL 
BE ACCOMMODATED AT A COVID-19 APPROVED HOTEL/PROPERTY SITE OR
AT A GOVERNMENT INSTITUTIONAL QUARANTINE FACILITY, AS APPROPRIATE.
11) FLIGHT CREW WILL BE EXEMPT FROM TESTING REQUIREMENTS, BUT 
WILL BE SUBJECT TO TEMPERATURE SCREENING ON ARRIVAL. ANY CREW
MEMBERS WHO ARE SYMPTOMATIC DURING SCREENING MAY BE SUBJECT TO
TESTING. WHEN A LAYOVER STAY IN SAINT LUCIA IS REQUIRED, FLIGHT
CREW MUST USE A COVID-19 CERTIFIED PROPERTY FOR ACCOMMODATION.
12) ALL VISITORS ARE REQUIRED TO FOLLOW LOCAL REGULATIONS IN
SAINT LUCIA, 
INCLUDING WEARING OF
MASKS IN PUBLIC PLACES, AT AIRPORTS, AND ON PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION.
VISITORS ACCOMMODATED AT A COVID CERTIFIED PROPERTY MUST REMAIN
AT THE PROPERTY.
13) INFORMATION ABOUT SAINT LUCIA COVID-19 RESPONSE, ALL PROTOCOLS
AND OTHER DETAILS ON REQUIREMENTS PRIOR TO ENTRY MAY BE ACCESSED
AT WWW.STLUCIA.ORG/COVID-19.
THE COMPETENT AUTHORITY MAY IMPOSE FURTHER TRAVEL RESTRICTIONS, 
IF REQUIRED.
ANEMOMETER RWY 28 U/S.

icaolocation: TKPK ROBERT L BRADSHAW ST CHRISTOPHER
Text:
ALL OPERATORS OF INBOUND FLIGHTS SHALL ENSURE ALL PASSENGERS 
PRESENT A VALID NEGATIVE PCR TEST AND LETTER INDICATING THEY HAVE 
WRITTEN AUTHORIZATION TO ENTER ST. KITTS. OPERATORS SHALL ALSO 
INDICATE THE FOLLOWING:
DATE OF FLIGHT
AIRCRAFT REGISTRATION
POINT OF DEPARTURE
PAX IN

AS PER STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NUMBER 86C OF 2021, COVID-19 TESTING
AND QUARANTINE REGULATIONS. 
1) A PERSON IS FULLY VACCINATED WHEN TWO WEEKS HAVE PASSED SINCE
THIS PERSON LAST RECEIVED: 
(A) A SINGLE-DOSE VACCINE, SUCH AS, JOHNSON AND JOHNSON,
(B) THE SECOND DOSE IN A TWO-DOSE SERIES OF ASTRAZENECA,
PFIZER-BIONTECH OR MODERNA OR 
(C) ANOTHER COVID-19 VACCINE APPROVED BY THE MINISTER ON THE ADVICE
OF 
THE CHIEF MEDICAL OFFICER. 
2) PURSUANT TO SECTION 3 OF THE AFOREMENTIONED STATUTORY
INSTRUMENT, 
A NATIONAL, RESIDENT OR NON-NATIONAL ARRIVING IN SAINT LUCIA SHALL
NOT BE PLACED 
IN QUARANTINE AT A QUARANTINE FACILITY OR AT HIS OR HER HOME, IF HE
OR SHE PROVIDES 
DOCUMENTED PROOF OF: 
(A) A NEGATIVE POLYMERASE CHAIN REACTION (PCR) TEST RESULT FOR
COVID-19 OBTAINED 
WITHIN 5 DAYS/120 HOURS PRIOR TO DATE OF PLANNED ARRIVAL IN SAINT
LUCIA AND 
(B) THAT HE OR SHE IS FULLY VACCINATED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ARTICLE
1) ABOVE.
3) THE CHIEF MEDICAL OFFICER IS NOT PREVENTED FROM PLACING A PERSON
WHO IS FULLY
VACCINATED IN QUARANTINE IN ORDER TO PROTECT THE HEALTH OF THE
PERSON OR 
FOR PUBLIC HEALTH. 
ALL ARRIVING ADULT PASSENGERS (AGE 18 YEARS AND OVER) MUST COMPLETE
THE RELEVANT 
PRE-ARRIVAL REGISTRATION FORM AT WWW.STLUCIA.ORG/COVID-19. 
MINORS (AGE 17 YEARS AND UNDER) MUST BE INCLUDED ON THE
REGISTRATION FORM OF 
THEIR ACCOMPANYING PARENT OR GUARDIAN. UNACCOMPANIED MINORS MUST
HAVE A 
PRE-ARRIVAL FORM SUBMITTED ON THEIR BEHALF.
PRECISION APPROACH PATH INDICATOR RWY 28 UNAVAILABLE.

 SAFE IN NATURE-CERTIFIED PROPERTY FOR A MINIMUM OF 5 TO 7 DAYS.
(2) A PCR TEST WILL BE ADMINISTERED TO THE FULLY VACCINATED

THE FOLLOWING WILL APPLY,

HIGH TEMPERATURE, HIGH RISK ALERT FROM QUESTIONNAIRE OR POSITIVE

(1) TRAVELLERS WILL PROCEED TO SECONDARY SCREENING AREA. 
(2) A PCR TEST WILL BE ADMINISTERED TO THE TRAVELLER. 
(3) TRAVELLERS WILL BE CONVEYED TO A MANDATORY QUARANTINE AT A
GOVERNMENT 
APPROVED FACILITY OR GOVERNMENT CERTIFIED HOTEL AT THE TRAVELLER'S
EXPENSE 
AWAITING RESULTS. 
(4) IF THE TEST RESULT IS POSITIVE, THE TRAVELLER MAY BE
QUARANTINED UNTIL 
RELEASE BY AN AUTHORIZED HEALTH PROFESSIONAL.
CHILDREN UNDER 5 YEARS ARE EXEMPTED FROM TESTING FEES.

(1) VEHICLES WILL ONLY BE PERMITTED TO ENTER
THE AIR AND SEAPORT WITH THE
DRIVER AND PERSONS DUE TO TRAVEL.

DEPARTURE 
PROCESS UNTIL DEPARTURE FROM AIRPORT. 
(3) TRAVELLERS MUST OBSERVE PHYSICAL DISTANCING.

SANITATION. 
(5) FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS OF HEALTH CARE STAFF AND OFFICIALS.

WITHIN 5 DAYS/120 HOURS OF TRAVEL.
7) ALL ARRIVING ADULT PASSENGERS (AGE 18 YEARS AND OLDER) MUST 
COMPLETE THE RELEVANT PRE-ARRIVAL REGISTRATION FORM AT
WWW.STLUCIA.ORG/COVID-19. MINORS (AGE 17 YEARS AND YOUNGER)
MUST BE INCLUDED ON THE REGISTRATION FORM OF THEIR ACCOMPANYING
PARENT OR GUARDIAN. UNACCOMPANIED MINORS MUST HAVE A PRE-ARRIVAL
FORM SUBMITTED ON THEIR BEHALF.
8) ALL DETAILS ON THE PRE-ARRIVAL REGISTRATION FORM MUST BE 
COMPLETED, INCLUDING PROOF OF NEGATIVE PCR TEST.
9) QUARANTINE SHALL BE DEEMED TO BE A PERIOD OF NO LESS THAN 
14 DAYS.
10) ALL ARRIVING PASSENGERS WHO ARE NOT FULLY VACCINATED FOR
COVID-19, IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NUMBER 86C
OF 2021 (COVID-19 TESTING AND QUARANTINE REGULATIONS), SHALL 
BE ACCOMMODATED AT A COVID-19 APPROVED HOTEL/PROPERTY SITE OR
AT A GOVERNMENT INSTITUTIONAL QUARANTINE FACILITY, AS APPROPRIATE.
11) FLIGHT CREW WILL BE EXEMPT FROM TESTING REQUIREMENTS, BUT 
WILL BE SUBJECT TO TEMPERATURE SCREENING ON ARRIVAL. ANY CREW
MEMBERS WHO ARE SYMPTOMATIC DURING SCREENING MAY BE SUBJECT TO
TESTING. WHEN A LAYOVER STAY IN SAINT LUCIA IS REQUIRED, FLIGHT
CREW MUST USE A COVID-19 CERTIFIED PROPERTY FOR ACCOMMODATION.
12) ALL VISITORS ARE REQUIRED TO FOLLOW LOCAL REGULATIONS IN
SAINT LUCIA, 
INCLUDING WEARING OF
MASKS IN PUBLIC PLACES, AT AIRPORTS, AND ON PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION.
VISITORS ACCOMMODATED AT A COVID CERTIFIED PROPERTY MUST REMAIN
AT THE PROPERTY.
13) INFORMATION ABOUT SAINT LUCIA COVID-19 RESPONSE, ALL PROTOCOLS
AND OTHER DETAILS ON REQUIREMENTS PRIOR TO ENTRY MAY BE ACCESSED
AT WWW.STLUCIA.ORG/COVID-19.
THE COMPETENT AUTHORITY MAY IMPOSE FURTHER TRAVEL RESTRICTIONS, 
IF REQUIRED.

AS PER SECTION 10 OF STATUTORY INSTRUMENT OF THE GOVERNMENT OF 
SAINT LUCIA, NUMBER 114 OF 2020: TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS.
THE GEORGE F. L. CHARLES AIRPORT IS OPEN TO REGIONAL AND 
INTERNATIONAL FLIGHTS. 
FOR THE PURPOSES OF PREVENTING, CONTROLLING AND SUPPRESSING 
THE SPREAD OF COVID-19:
1) ALL DEPARTING PASSENGERS WILL BE SUBJECT TO TEMPERATURE 
SCREENING.
2) ALL ARRIVING PASSENGERS WILL BE FIRST PROCESSED BY PORT 
HEALTH UPON ARRIVAL INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, TEMPERATURE 
SCREENING.
3) EFFECTIVE 01 JULY 2021, SAINT LUCIA WILL NO LONGER UPHOLD A
CARIBBEAN BUBBLE.
4) ALL ARRIVING PASSENGERS ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE DOCUMENTED
PROOF OF A NEGATIVE POLYMERASE CHAIN REACTION (PCR) TEST RESULT
FOR COVID-19 OBTAINED WITHIN 5 DAYS/120 HOURS PRIOR TO DATE
OF PLANNED ARRIVAL IN SAINT LUCIA. PROOF OF THE NEGATIVE PCR 
TEST RESULT FOR COVID-19, MUST BE PRESENTED PRIOR TO DEPARTURE
AND UPON ARRIVAL IN SAINT LUCIA.
5) NOTWITHSTANDING AN ARRIVING PASSENGER PRESENTING PROOF OF THE 
REQUIRED NEGATIVE RESULT OF A PCR TEST FOR COVID-19 OBTAINED WITHIN
5 DAYS/120 HOURS OF TRAVEL TO SAINT LUCIA, A DETERMINATION CAN BE 
MADE UPON ARRIVAL AND BASED ON ASSESSMENT BY THE RELEVANT HEALTH
AUTHORITIES THAT ANOTHER PCR TEST OF THE PASSENGER IS REQUIRED.
THE ARRIVING PASSENGER WILL BE SO TESTED AND WILL BE REQUIRED TO
PAY FOR THE PCR TEST IN THE AMOUNT OF 270.00 XCD, IN ACCORDANCE 
WITH THE PROVISION OF STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NUMBER 118 OF 2020.
6) IN-TRANSIT PASSENGERS TRANSFERRING ON THE SAME DAY WILL BE
SUBJECT TO TEMPERATURE SCREENING ON ARRIVAL. IT IS STRONGLY 
ADVISED THAT IN-TRANSIT PASSENGERS OBTAIN A NEGATIVE PCR TEST
TWR AND APP AVBL ON FREQ 118.300 MHZ WITH LIMITED RANGE
AD ROTATING BEACON U/S.
TWR FREQ 118.80MHZ OPR ON REDUCED COVERAGE.

Text: TWY 'A' AVBL FOR DAYLIGHT OPS.

ASSUMED TO BE HIGH
RISK.
5. HIGH-RISK OCCUPATIONS INCLUDE:
A. HEALTH CARE WORKERS (CURRENT) 
B. PRISON/DETENTION FACILITY WORKERS. 
6. IN-TRANSIT PASSENGERS:
A. THROUGH ST. VINCENT AND THE GRENADINES:
I. MUST HAVE A NEGATIVE COVID-19 PCR TEST RESULT DONE WITHIN
SEVENTY-TWO (72) HOURS OF ARRIVAL.
II. IF THE IN-TRANSIT PERIOD DOES NOT INCLUDE AN OVERNIGHT STAY,
THAT PERIOD MUST BE SPENT 
AT THE ARGYLE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT.
III. IF THE IN-TRANSIT PERIOD INCLUDES AN OVERNIGHT STAY, THAT
PERIOD MUST BE SPENT IN A 
TA/MOHWE APPROVED HOTEL.
B. TRAVELLERS INTENDING TO TRANSIT THROUGH ANOTHER COUNTRY FROM ST.
VINCENT AND THE
GRENADINES ARE ADVISED TO VISIT THE COUNTRY'S TRAVEL WEBSITE TO
DETERMINE THE 
REQUIREMENTS FOR TRAVEL. FOR
I. GRENADA -
HTTPS://WWW.NOWGRENADA.COM/2020/07/PROTOCOL-FOR-TRAVELLERS-INTO-GRENA
DA/
II. ANTIGUA - HTTPS://VISITANTIGUABARBUDA.COM/TRAVEL-ADVISORY/
III. BARBADOS-
HTTPS://WWW.VISITBARBADOS.ORG/COVID-19-TRAVEL-GUIDELINES-2020
IV. ST. LUCIA- HTTPS://WWW.STLUCIA.ORG/EN/COVID-19/
7. DIPLOMATS:
A. MUST HAVE A NEGATIVE PCR COVID-19
TEST RESULT DONE WITHIN SEVENTY TWO (72) HOURS OF ARRIVAL.
B. ALL DIPLOMATS MUST QUARANTINE FOR THE DURATION OF TIME AS PER
THE APPROVED PROTOCOLS.
THE SITE OF QUARANTINE WILL BE AT THE DISCRETION OF THE CHIEF
MEDICAL OFFICER OR THE MEDICAL
 OFFICER OF HEALTH.
8. MINORS AS TRAVELERS:
A. PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF EIGHTEEN (18) YEARS ARE CONSIDERED
MINORS.
B. SHALL FOLLOW THE PROTOCOL APPLIED TO THEIR PARENTS OR GUARDIAN.
C. WHEN TRAVELLING ALONE WILL BE QUARANTINED WITH A GUARDIAN IN A
PRIVATE RESIDENCE FOR THE
PERIOD AS DETERMINED BY THEIR COUNTRY OF ORIGIN AND THEIR
VACCINATION STATUS.)

DOMINICAN REPUBLIC, HAITI, CUBA, NIGERIA, INDONESIA, PHILIPPINES,
ITALY, BAHAMAS, CANADA,
TURKS AND CAICOS ISLANDS, FRANCE (INCLUDING OVERSEAS REGIONS),
SPAIN AND RUSSIA.
II. MUST ARRIVE WITH A NEGATIVE RESULT OF A COVID-19 (RT-PCR) TEST
DONE
NO MORE THAN SEVENTY-TWO (72) HOURS OR THREE (3) DAYS BEFORE
ARRIVAL.
III. MAY BE RETESTED FOR COVID-19 (RT-PCR) ON ARRIVAL IN ST.
VINCENT AND THE GRENADINES.
IV. MAY BE MANDATORY FOR QUARANTINE FOR  FORTY-EIGHT(48) HOURS IN
A
TOURISM AUTHORITY/MOHWE APPROVED TRANSITION/QUARANTINE
HOTEL/PROPERTY AT THEIR COST TO AWAIT RELEASE FROM QUARANTINE BY A
PUBLIC HEALTH
 OFFICER.
B. LOW-RISK COUNTRIES (THE COUNTRY OF RESIDENCE WILL BE THE LAST
COUNTRY THAT THE
TRAVELLER WAS PRESENT IN FOR AT LEAST TWENTY-ONE (21) DAYS):
I. ANGUILLA, MONTSERRAT?
II. MUST ARRIVE WITH A NEGATIVE RESULT OF A COVID-19 (RT-PCR) TEST
DONE NO MORE THAN SEVENTY-TWO (72) HOURS BEFORE ARRIVAL.
III. MAY BE TESTED  FOR COVID-19 ON ARRIVAL IN ST. VINCENT AND THE
GRENADINES AT THE
DISCRETION OF THE PORT HEALTH OFFICER.
IV. NO QUARANTINE IF NO EVIDENCE OF ONBOARD VESSEL EXPOSURE AND NOT
IN A HIGH-RISK 
OCCUPATION.
3. RESORT SPECIFIC BUBBLE PROTOCOL HOTELS IN ST. VINCENT AND THE
GRENADINES:
A. RESORT SPECIFIC PROTOCOLS MUST BE APPROVED BY THE HEALTH
SERVICES
SUBCOMMITTEE AND ALSO BEAR THE STAMP OF THE NATIONAL EMERGENCY
ORGANIZATION
(NEMO).
B. RESORT SPECIFIC BUBBLE PROTOCOL APPROVED HOTELS - MANDARIN
ORIENTAL
CANOUAN, SOHO BEACH HOUSE CANOUAN, CANOUAN ESTATES RESORT AND
VILLAS,
BEQUIA BEACH HOTEL, PETIT ST. VINCENT ISLAND ? RESORT, MUSTIQUE.
4. ANY OTHER COUNTRY NOT ASSIGNED TO THE ABOVE CATEGORIES SHOULD BE

(1) SUBMIT A HEALTH QUESTIONNAIRE ONLINE AT LEAST 24 HOURS
PRIOR
TO ARRIVAL IN TDPD AT HTTP://DOMCOVID19.DOMINICA.GOV.DM. 
(2) SHOW THE NOTIFICATION OF CLEARANCE TO TRAVEL. 
(3) SUBMIT A NEGATIVE PCR TEST RESULT RECORDED WITHIN 24-72 HOURS 
PRIOR TO ARRIVAL.
GENERAL PROTOCOLS AND GUIDELINES UPON ARRIVAL:
(1) TRAVELLERS ARE REQUIRED TO WEAR FACE MASKS AT ALL TIMES DURING
ARRIVAL PROCESS UP TO AND INCLUDING DEPARTURE FROM THE AIRPORT. 
(2) MUST OBSERVE PHYSICAL DISTANCING GUIDELINES. 
(3) MUST PRACTICE GOOD RESPIRATORY AND PERSONAL SANITATION. 
(4) MUST FOLLOW ALL INSTRUCTIONS OF HEALTH CARE STAFF AND
OFFICIALS.
VACCINATED PASSENGERS: DISEMBARKATION 
TRAVELLERS WILL: 
(1) BE REQUIRED TO SANITIZE THEIR HANDS AT SANITATION STATIONS AS
DIRECTED.
(2) BE REQUIRED TO UNDERGO A HEALTH ASSESSMENT TO INCLUDE A 
TEMPERATURE CHECK. 
(3) PROVIDE CONFIRMATION OF THE HEALTH CLEARANCE TO TRAVEL,
NEGATIVE
PCR TEST RESULTS, VACCINATION CERTIFICATE AND IF APPLICABLE,
MEDICAL RECORD AS 
PROOF OF PREVIOUS INFECTION OF COVID-19. 
VACCINATED PASSENGERS: QUARANTINE AND TESTING.
(1) FULLY VACCINATED PASSENGERS SHALL BE TRANSPORTED TO A
GOVERNMENT-OPERATED
QUARANTINE FACILITY OR A MANAGED EXPERIENCE AT A SAFE IN
NATURE-CERTIFIED
 PROPERTY FOR A MINIMUM OF 2 DAYS. 
(2) A PCR TEST WILL BE ADMINISTERED TO THE FULLY VACCINATED
TRAVELLER 
ON DAY 2 AFTER ARRIVAL AND THE TRAVELLER WILL AWAIT THE RESULTS FOR
UP TO 24
HOURS.
UNVACCINATED PASSENGERS: DISEMBARKATION
(1) BE REQUIRED TO SANITIZE THEIR HANDS
AT SANITATION STATIONS AS
DIRECTED.
(2) BE REQUIRED TO UNDERGO A HEALTH ASSESSMENT TO INCLUDE A 
TEMPERATURE CHECK.
(3) PROVIDE CONFIRMATION OF THE HEALTH CLEARANCE TO TRAVEL,

Text:
THE GOVERNMENT OF ST. KITTS AND NEVIS HAS ISSUED NEW TRAVEL
REQUIREMENTS 
FOR INTERNATIONAL TRAVELERS.
1. ONLY FULLY VACCINATED TRAVELERS WILL BE ALLOWED ENTRY INTO ST.
KITTS AND NEVIS 
WHERE THEY SHALL REMAIN IN A GOVERNMENT APPROVED COVID-19 HOTEL OR
QUARANTINE 
FACILITY FOR 24 HOURS.
2. NON-VACCINATED CHILDREN UNDER 18 TRAVELING WITH FULLY VACCINATED
PARENTS OR 
GUARDIANS WILL BE TREATED THE SAME AS THEIR PARENTS OR GUARDIANS
AND WILL 
QUARANTINE FOR 24 HOURS.
3. EXEMPTIONS WILL BE MADE FOR CITIZENS AND RESIDENTS. UNVACCINATED
RETURNING 
CITIZENS AND RESIDENTS WILL QUARANTINE FOR 14 DAYS.
FURTHER INFORMATION CAN BE FOUND ON THE TOURISM WEBSITE 
(WWW.STKITTSTOURISM.KN/TRAVEL-REQUIREMENTS).
